intro: Hieracium scariolaceum, commonly known as the scarlet hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, reaching heights of up to 60 centimeters. Its flowers are bright yellow and bloom from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium scariolaceum is often found in temperate climates and is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
